result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)
Ignition Interlock Device Tampering/Failure to Install/Violate Court Order

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ward A Samuelson

records.addlTxt:
9:40 AM Defendant Ward A Samuelson in court.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Prosecuting attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews file, asks why he does not have counsel yet. Samuelson responds, trying to get retainer fee for Attorney Kennedy, needs a month. Court will allow one more adjournment, reminds of his right to court appointed attorney, gives ramifications of appearing without counsel, sets for AIA on 11/30/22 at 9:30 AM, would consider releasing the bond for a portion of the retainer fee.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 30, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on November 30, 2022 at 09:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Ward A Samuelson
Current: 4748 Ash Street, Laona, WI 54541   (Effective: 09-06-2022)
Prior: 4746 Cherry St # 105, Laona, WI 54541

9:39 AM  Defendant Ward A Samuelson in court.  Prosecuting attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant has received a copy of the criminal complaint this morning, in court. Court reads charges and penalties. Defendant understands. Court questions if they have contacted an attorney. Defendant has not, waiting for complaint, will be talking with Attorney Kennedy. Court advises of options for obtaining an attorney; private hire, SPD or court appointed if not eligible for SPD. Defendant understands. Court will have set for AIA and continues bond.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on October 5, 2022 at 09:45 am.
No consumption of alcohol. No operation of a motor vehicle without a valid license or without and IID installed.
